flounder.guis

Class GuiComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • flounder.guis.GuiComponent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GuiScreenContainer, GuiTextButton

    public abstract class GuiComponent
extends java.lang.Object
    An component of a GUI. Implementations of this range from a whole GUI frame to a single button. All components can have subtract-components, and the parent component has the responsibility of keeping the subtract-components updated.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GuiComponent

        public GuiComponent()

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(java.util.List<GuiTexture> guiTextures,
                   java.util.Map<FontType,java.util.List<Text>> texts)
        Updates the component and all of its child-components, as well as filling the list of GuiTextures with any textures that this component or any of its subtract-components need to be rendered. It also removes any subtract components that have indicated that they need to be removed.
        Parameters:
        guiTextures - The list of GuiTextures to be rendered.
        texts - The map of texts to be rendered this frame.

      • updateSelf

        protected abstract void updateSelf()
        Updates the functionality of this particular component.

      • getGuiTextures

        protected abstract void getGuiTextures(java.util.List<GuiTexture> guiTextures)
        Adds any of this component's GuiTextures.
        Parameters:
        guiTextures - The list of GUI textures that are going to be rendered. This method adds any necessary GuiTextures from this component to that list.

      • addComponent

        public void addComponent(GuiComponent component,
                         float relX,
                         float relY,
                         float relScaleX,
                         float relScaleY)
        Add a subtract-component to this component.
        Parameters:
        component - The subtract=component.
        relX - The x position of the top-left corner of the child component, in relation to this component (0 is the left edge of this component, 1 is the right edge).
        relY - The y position of the top-left corner of the child component, in relation to this component (0 is the top edge of this component, 1 is the bottom edge).
        relScaleX - The x scale of the child component, in relation to the x scale of this component.
        relScaleY - The y scale of the child component, in relation to the y scale of this component.

      • removeComponent

        public void removeComponent(GuiComponent component,
                            boolean deleteObject)
        Indicates that a child component should be removed from this component and deleted.
        Parameters:
        component - The child component to be removed.
        deleteObject - If true the object will be cleared and deleted.

      • addText

        public void addText(Text text,
                    float relX,
                    float relY,
                    float relLineWidth)
        Adds some text to the component.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to be added.
        relX - The x position of the left edge of the text, relative to this component's size and position (0 = far left edge, 1 = far right).
        relY - The y position of the top edge of the text, relative to this component's size and position (0 = top edge, 1 = bottom edge).
        relLineWidth - The width of the line of text, relative to the width of the component.

      • deleteText

        public void deleteText(Text text)
        Removes some text from the component and deletes the text.
        Parameters:
        text - The text currently in the component that needs to be removed.

      • updateScreenSpacePosition

        protected void updateScreenSpacePosition()
        Calculates the screen space position of the component based on their relative position and the screen-space position of their parent.

      • setScreenSpacePosition

        protected void setScreenSpacePosition(float x,
                                      float y,
                                      float width,
                                      float height)
        Sets the screen-space position and dimensions of this component. (0, 0) is the top left of the screen and (1, 1) is the bottom right.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position of the top-left of the component in screen-space.
        y - The y position of the top-left of the component in screen-space.
        width - The width of the component in screen-space.
        height - The height of the component in screen-space.

      • increaseRelativePosition

        public void increaseRelativePosition(float dX,
                                     float dY)
        Increases the relative position of the component.
        Parameters:
        dX - The direction in the X component.
        dY - The direction in the Y component.

      • isMouseOver

        protected boolean isMouseOver()
        Returns:
        true if the mouse cursor is currently over this component.

      • isShown

        public boolean isShown()
        Returns:
        true if this component isn't currently hidden.

      • show

        public void show(boolean visible)
        Determines whether the component (and all subtract-components) should be visible or not. Non-visible components are not updated.
        Parameters:
        visible - Whether the component should be visible or not.

      • getPosition

        protected Vector2f getPosition()
        Returns:
        The screen-space position of the top-left corner of the component.

      • getScale

        protected Vector2f getScale()
        Returns:
        The screen-space x and y scales of the component.

      • getRelativeX

        public float getRelativeX()
        Returns:
        The x position of the top-left corner of the component, relative to the parent component.

      • setRelativeX

        public void setRelativeX(float x)

      • getRelativeY

        public float getRelativeY()
        Returns:
        The y position of the top-left corner of the component, relative to the parent component.

      • setRelativeY

        public void setRelativeY(float y)
